brandIdentity.designSummary: This brand design features a modern, minimalistic aesthetic with a strong emphasis on grid-based structure and high contrast. The primary colors are black and white, providing a clean and professional backdrop, while vibrant orange and soft lavender gradients serve as accent colors to highlight key interactive elements and create visual interest. Typography is monospaced and typewriter-inspired, reinforcing a technical and coding-related theme. The layout is modular and asymmetrical, using clear columns and rows with visible grid lines to evoke a sense of precision and order. UI components such as buttons are sharp-edged and functional, primarily using the 'secondary' orange color for calls to action. The overall visual personality is futuristic, energetic, and tech-savvy, suitable for technology conferences or digital product showcases.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Professional, innovative, precise, and energetic with a tech-savvy and modern personality.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' black color predominantly for backgrounds and large text blocks to create strong contrast with the 'primaryForeground' white text. The 'secondary' orange color is reserved for call-to-action buttons, highlights, and interactive elements, paired with 'secondaryForeground' black text for readability. The 'lavenderGradientStart' and 'lavenderGradientEnd' colors form a smooth gradient used in large background blocks and overlays to add a modern, digital feel without overwhelming the design. The 'gridLine' color is used subtly for background grid lines to reinforce the structured, technical aesthetic. These colors should be combined thoughtfully to maintain accessibility and visual hierarchy, ensuring that text and interactive elements stand out clearly against their backgrounds.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primaryForeground' white text on 'primary' black background meets WCAG AAA contrast standards for all text sizes. The 'secondaryForeground' black text on 'secondary' orange background meets WCAG AA standards for normal text and AAA for large text. The lavender gradient colors provide sufficient contrast when used with black text for headings and body copy. The 'gridLine' color is light and used only for non-interactive background elements, ensuring no accessibility issues.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the 'azeret-mono' font for all headings to maintain a consistent, technical aesthetic. Headings should be uppercase or sentence case with generous letter spacing to enhance readability and emphasize the futuristic tone. Pair headings with paragraph text in the same font family but smaller size to maintain harmony. Use the 'primary' and 'secondary' colors for headings depending on background context to ensure strong contrast and accessibility.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'azeret-mono' with 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' or 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' backgrounds meet WCAG AAA contrast standards, ensuring clear readability.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the same 'azeret-mono' font for paragraphs to maintain a cohesive and minimalistic style. Body text should be smaller with normal letter spacing and line height optimized for readability. Use 'primary' or 'secondary' colors for text depending on background to maintain contrast. Avoid overly long lines by using grid-based layout and spacing. This font pairing supports the technical and modern brand tone.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text in 'azeret-mono' with 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' or 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' backgrounds meets WCAG AA standards for normal text and AAA for large text.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome or hero section uses large, bold headings anchored in the top third of the viewport, creating immediate visual impact. The text is left-aligned with generous spacing, supported by a modular grid layout. Accent colors from the palette highlight key phrases or calls to action, while the background uses gradient blocks to add depth without distracting from the typography.

components.containers: Containers use solid backgrounds in 'background' white or gradient blocks from 'lavenderGradientStart' to 'lavenderGradientEnd'. They maintain consistent padding and margin to preserve the grid structure. Borders or outlines use the 'gridLine' color subtly to define sections without clutter.
components.images: Images are black and white portraits with clean edges, integrated into the grid with consistent sizing. They maintain a professional and minimalistic style, complementing the monospaced typography and overall tech theme.
components.buttons: Buttons are rectangular with sharp edges, primarily filled with the 'secondary' orange color and text in 'secondaryForeground' black. Secondary buttons may use transparent backgrounds with orange borders and black text. Buttons have consistent padding and are sized to be easily clickable, emphasizing calls to action.

graphicElements.icons: Icons, if used, would be minimalistic, line-based, and monochromatic, primarily using 'primaryForeground' white or 'secondary' orange for emphasis. They align with the monospaced, technical aesthetic.
graphicElements.illustrations: No illustrations are present; the design relies on geometric shapes and gradients for visual interest.
graphicElements.stickers: No stickers or badges are used, maintaining a clean and professional look.

brandIdentity.designSummary: The design aesthetic is a modern, experimental editorial style that combines bold typography with textured, layered backgrounds. The primary color palette features a deep forest green and bright yellow accents set against muted, textured blue and green backgrounds, creating a high-contrast yet sophisticated visual experience. Typography plays a central role, with large, uppercase geometric sans-serif headings paired with monospaced, typewriter-style body text, emphasizing a tech-forward and innovative tone. The layout is asymmetrical and modular, with generous negative space and overlapping elements that create a dynamic, layered composition. Subtle pixelated and jagged geometric shapes in the background add a tactile, digital texture, reinforcing the brand's focus on innovation and creativity. Overall, the design conveys a bold, intellectual, and approachable personality suitable for cutting-edge design and technology events.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Innovative, bold, intellectual, experimental, and approachable with a tech-savvy edge.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' color for main headings, navigation links, and key textual elements to establish brand recognition and consistency. The 'secondary' color serves as an accent for highlights, call-to-actions, and important labels, providing vibrant contrast against the 'background' and 'backgroundLight' colors. The 'background' color and its variants ('backgroundLight' and 'backgroundDark') create textured, layered backdrops that add depth without overwhelming content. Text should primarily use 'primary' on lighter backgrounds and 'secondaryForeground' or 'textBlack' on darker backgrounds to ensure readability. The 'primaryForeground' color is reserved for text or icons placed on 'primary' colored backgrounds. Maintain high contrast between text and backgrounds to meet accessibility standards. Avoid mixing 'primary' and 'secondary' colors in close proximity to prevent visual clutter. Instead, use them strategically to guide user attention and create a balanced visual hierarchy.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primary' color (#0B4D0B) on the 'background' (#8A9DC3) provides sufficient contrast exceeding WCAG AA standards for large and normal text. The 'secondary' color (#F2E94E) on 'backgroundDark' (#0B3A0B) also meets WCAG AA contrast requirements for text and UI elements. Text in 'primaryForeground' (#FFFFFF) on 'primary' (#0B4D0B) backgrounds achieves excellent contrast for readability. Care should be taken when using 'secondary' on lighter backgrounds to ensure text remains legible, preferably using 'secondaryForeground' (#000000) for text on 'secondary' backgrounds. Overall, the palette supports accessible design with strong contrast pairs for headings, body text, and interactive elements.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the 'league spartan' font for all primary headings in uppercase to create strong visual impact and brand presence. Pair with body text fonts to maintain clear hierarchy and readability. Headings should have tight letter spacing and be sized significantly larger than body text to establish emphasis. Use the 'primary' color for headings on light backgrounds and 'primaryForeground' on dark backgrounds to ensure contrast. Avoid mixing heading colors with 'secondary' except for special highlights or callouts.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'league spartan' with 'primary' color on 'background' meet WCAG AA contrast standards for all sizes. Ensure font sizes for headings are large enough to maintain readability and accessibility.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use 'azeret-mono' for body text, captions, and smaller informational text to complement the bold headings with a distinct, tech-savvy character. Text should be left-aligned with comfortable line spacing for readability. Use the 'primary' color for body text on light backgrounds and 'textWhite' or 'secondaryForeground' on darker backgrounds. Avoid using 'secondary' for large blocks of text to maintain legibility. Combine with headings to create a balanced typographic hierarchy that supports scanning and comprehension.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Body text in 'azeret-mono' with 'primary' color on 'background' meets WCAG AA contrast requirements. Maintain sufficient font size and line height to support accessibility.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section uses a large, bold heading placed asymmetrically on the left side of the screen, with supporting text blocks arranged in a modular grid to the right and below. This placement creates a dynamic visual flow that draws attention to the main message while allowing secondary information to be easily scanned. The typography scales responsively, maintaining hierarchy and balance across screen sizes. The use of uppercase for headings and monospaced font for body text reinforces the experimental and tech-forward brand personality.

components.containers: Containers use solid background colors from the palette, primarily 'background' and 'backgroundDark', with generous padding and subtle textured overlays to add depth. They maintain clear separation between content blocks while supporting the layered, modular layout. Borders are minimal or absent, relying on color contrast and spacing for structure.
components.images: Images are presented in clean, square frames with no borders, integrated asymmetrically within the layout. They often overlap with text blocks or background shapes, creating a collage-like effect. Images maintain natural colors and contrast well against the muted backgrounds.
components.buttons: Buttons use the 'primary' color for solid backgrounds with 'primaryForeground' text for primary actions. Secondary buttons use transparent backgrounds with 'primary' colored borders and text. Hover states invert these colors for clear interactivity feedback. Buttons have sharp edges and minimal padding, consistent with the geometric, modern aesthetic.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are minimal, monochromatic, and use the 'primary' or 'textBlack' colors. They maintain a simple, geometric style consistent with the typography and overall design language.
graphicElements.illustrations: No custom illustrations are present; the design relies on photographic content and geometric background shapes for visual interest.
graphicElements.stickers: No stickers or badges are used in the design, maintaining a clean and uncluttered visual presentation.

brandIdentity.designSummary: The design features a modern dark mode aesthetic with a solid black background that creates a sleek and immersive environment. Vibrant neon green and bright blue accent colors energize the interface, highlighting interactive elements and branding. Typography is geometric, clean, and sans-serif, with large, bold headings that mix white and neon green to emphasize key messages. The layout is spacious and balanced, using a centered column grid with generous negative space and rounded corners on containers and buttons to soften the high-tech feel. The footer employs a modular grid with distinct colored blocks, maintaining visual consistency and clarity. Overall, the design conveys a cutting-edge, digital culture vibe suitable for a gaming or tech conference, combining high contrast, minimalism, and vibrant accents for a friendly yet professional look.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Futuristic, innovative, approachable, and tech-savvy with a casual yet professional personality.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' black color as the main background to create a sleek, immersive environment. The 'primaryForeground' white color is ideal for main text and icons to ensure maximum readability and contrast. The 'secondary' blue color should be used for branding elements such as color blocks,UI cards, repeters logos and footer backgrounds, paired with 'secondaryForeground' white for text and icons. The 'accentNeonGreen' color is reserved for interactive elements like buttons, badges, and icons to draw user attention and convey energy and innovation. The 'accentPeach' color provides a subtle warm contrast in secondary UI elements such as social media icon backgrounds, balancing the cool palette. Combine these colors thoughtfully to maintain high contrast and accessibility, ensuring that text and interactive elements stand out clearly against backgrounds.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The combination of 'primaryForeground' white on 'primary' black background meets WCAG AAA contrast standards for text readability. The 'accentNeonGreen' on black also provides excellent contrast, suitable for buttons and badges. The 'secondaryForeground' white on 'secondary' blue background meets WCAG AA standards for text. The 'accentPeach' on blue background should be used for non-critical elements or icons to maintain sufficient contrast. Overall, the palette supports strong accessibility compliance for text and interactive elements.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font in large sizes with bold weight to create impactful titles and section headers. Mix white and 'accentNeonGreen' colors to highlight key words or phrases, enhancing visual hierarchy. Pair headings with paragraph fonts by maintaining clear spacing and contrast. Ensure headings remain legible on dark backgrounds by using 'primaryForeground' or 'accentNeonGreen' colors. Avoid overly condensed or decorative styles to preserve clarity.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'primaryForeground' white or 'accentNeonGreen' on 'primary' black background meet WCAG AAA contrast standards, ensuring excellent readability for all users.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font in regular weight and moderate sizes for body text, descriptions, and navigation links. Maintain high contrast by using 'primaryForeground' white on 'primary' black or 'secondary' blue backgrounds. Ensure sufficient line height and letter spacing for comfortable reading. Pair paragraphs with bold headings to create clear content hierarchy. Avoid using accent colors for large blocks of text to maintain readability.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text in 'primaryForeground' white on 'primary' black or 'secondary' blue backgrounds meets WCAG AA or higher contrast standards, supporting accessibility.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section uses a large, bold heading centered horizontally and vertically within the viewport. The heading text is split with a mix of 'primaryForeground' white and 'accentNeonGreen' colors to emphasize key words. Supporting text is placed below the heading in smaller white font, maintaining strong contrast. Interactive badges and date tags are positioned near the heading with rounded shapes and neon green backgrounds, reinforcing the futuristic theme. The overall typographic placement creates a strong focal point that immediately communicates the event's identity.

components.containers: Containers have rounded corners with solid backgrounds in black, neon green, blue, or peach depending on context. They maintain consistent padding and spacing, creating modular blocks that organize content clearly. The use of bright accent backgrounds for interactive or navigational containers draws user attention effectively.
components.images: Images are minimal or abstract, often replaced by graphic elements or logos. When present, images are framed within rounded containers or circular shapes to maintain design consistency.
components.buttons: Buttons are rounded with solid backgrounds in 'accentNeonGreen' or outlined in white. Text on buttons is white or black depending on background for maximum contrast. Buttons have clear hover states and are sized for easy interaction.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are simple, modern, and use the 'accentNeonGreen' color to stand out against dark backgrounds. They have rounded shapes consistent with the overall design language and are used sparingly to support navigation and calls to action.
graphicElements.illustrations: No prominent illustrations are used; the design relies on abstract shapes and logos to convey brand identity.
graphicElements.stickers: Badges and stickers use rounded pill shapes with 'accentNeonGreen' backgrounds and black text, providing clear, friendly labels for event types and dates.

brandIdentity.designSummary: This brand design embraces a modern, minimalistic aesthetic with a strong focus on clarity and user engagement. The layout is spacious and balanced, featuring generous white space and a clean white background that enhances readability and visual comfort. Typography is a key element, utilizing large, geometric sans-serif fonts for headings that convey professionalism and approachability, paired with clean, legible body text. The primary brand color is a vibrant purple used consistently for interactive elements such as buttons and highlighted text, providing energetic contrast against the neutral background. UI components like cards and buttons feature rounded corners and subtle shadows, adding softness and depth without cluttering the interface. The overall visual tone is tech-forward, innovative, and user-friendly, designed to communicate trust and ease of use across diverse digital platforms.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Professional, approachable, innovative, clear, and user-centric.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' color predominantly for call-to-action buttons, interactive elements, and key highlights to draw user attention. The 'primaryForeground' color should be used for text and icons placed on 'primary' backgrounds to ensure readability. The 'background' color provides a clean, neutral canvas for the entire site, while 'secondary' and 'cardBackground' colors are used for UI containers and cards to create subtle separation and layering without harsh contrast. Text should primarily use 'textPrimary' for maximum legibility. Buttons and interactive elements should combine 'buttonBackground' with 'buttonForeground' for clear visibility and accessibility. Input fields and other form elements should use 'inputBackground' with subtle 'inputBorder' colors to maintain a clean and unobtrusive appearance. This palette ensures a harmonious balance between vibrancy and neutrality, supporting a modern and accessible user experience.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' background achieves WCAG AA and AAA contrast ratios, ensuring text on buttons is highly legible. The 'textPrimary' on 'background' also meets WCAG AAA standards for body text readability. 'SecondaryForeground' on 'secondary' backgrounds provides sufficient contrast for UI containers and cards. Overall, the palette supports strong accessibility compliance for text and interactive elements.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font for all primary titles and section headers to establish clear hierarchy and brand personality. Pair with the paragraph font for body text to maintain readability and visual harmony. Maintain ample spacing above and below headings to enhance legibility and separation. Use 'primary' color for emphasis or black for neutral headings depending on context. Avoid overly tight letter spacing to preserve clarity.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings using 'textPrimary' on 'background' or 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' backgrounds meet WCAG AA and AAA contrast standards, ensuring accessibility for users with visual impairments.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for all body text, descriptions, and secondary information. Maintain consistent line height and letter spacing to enhance readability. Combine with heading fonts to create a balanced typographic hierarchy. Text color should primarily be 'textPrimary' on 'background' or 'secondary' containers. Avoid using paragraph fonts in all caps or overly bold weights to preserve legibility.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Body text using 'textPrimary' on 'background' or 'secondary' backgrounds meets WCAG AA and AAA contrast requirements for normal and large text sizes.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section places large, bold headings anchored in the top third of the viewport, aligned left with generous white space around. This placement draws immediate attention to the core message while leaving ample room below for supporting UI elements and calls to action. The heading uses the 'primary' color selectively to highlight key phrases, creating visual interest and guiding the user's eye. The call-to-action button is positioned near the heading with consistent spacing, using the 'primary' color background and 'primaryForeground' text for prominence. This typographic strategy balances impact with clarity, ensuring the welcome message is both inviting and easy to read.

components.containers: Containers use a light gray background ('cardBackground') with subtle drop shadows and rounded corners to create a soft, elevated effect. Padding inside containers is consistent to maintain content clarity and separation. Borders are minimal or absent, relying on shadows and spacing for definition.
components.images: Images and UI mockups are presented with rounded corners and subtle shadows to integrate smoothly with the overall soft UI style. They are balanced with text content to maintain visual harmony and avoid clutter.
components.buttons: Buttons are pill-shaped with solid 'primary' color backgrounds and 'primaryForeground' text. They have subtle hover states that slightly darken the background color for interactivity feedback. Secondary buttons use a transparent background with a 'primary' color border and text, maintaining consistency and accessibility.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are minimal, monochrome, and use the 'textPrimary' color to maintain visual consistency and clarity. They are sized appropriately to complement text without overpowering it.
graphicElements.illustrations: Illustrations are minimal or abstract, using soft gradients and subtle overlays that do not compete with the UI elements. They support the tech-forward and innovative brand personality.
graphicElements.stickers: No prominent use of stickers or badges is observed; if used, they should be subtle and consistent with the 'primary' color palette.

brandBook.toneOfVoice: Professional, innovative, precise, and energetic with a tech-savvy and modern personality.

components.images: Images are black and white portraits with clean edges, integrated into the grid with consistent sizing. They maintain a professional and minimalistic style, complementing the monospaced typography and overall tech theme.
components.buttons: Buttons are rectangular with sharp edges, primarily filled with the 'secondary' orange color and text in 'secondaryForeground' black. Secondary buttons may use transparent backgrounds with orange borders and black text. Buttons have consistent padding and are sized to be easily clickable, emphasizing calls to action.
components.containers: Containers use solid backgrounds in 'background' white or gradient blocks from 'lavenderGradientStart' to 'lavenderGradientEnd'. They maintain consistent padding and margin to preserve the grid structure. Borders or outlines use the 'gridLine' color subtly to define sections without clutter.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the 'azeret-mono' font for all headings to maintain a consistent, technical aesthetic. Headings should be uppercase or sentence case with generous letter spacing to enhance readability and emphasize the futuristic tone. Pair headings with paragraph text in the same font family but smaller size to maintain harmony. Use the 'primary' and 'secondary' colors for headings depending on background context to ensure strong contrast and accessibility.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'azeret-mono' with 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' or 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' backgrounds meet WCAG AAA contrast standards, ensuring clear readability.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the same 'azeret-mono' font for paragraphs to maintain a cohesive and minimalistic style. Body text should be smaller with normal letter spacing and line height optimized for readability. Use 'primary' or 'secondary' colors for text depending on background to maintain contrast. Avoid overly long lines by using grid-based layout and spacing. This font pairing supports the technical and modern brand tone.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text in 'azeret-mono' with 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' or 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' backgrounds meets WCAG AA standards for normal text and AAA for large text.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome or hero section uses large, bold headings anchored in the top third of the viewport, creating immediate visual impact. The text is left-aligned with generous spacing, supported by a modular grid layout. Accent colors from the palette highlight key phrases or calls to action, while the background uses gradient blocks to add depth without distracting from the typography.

graphicElements.icons: Icons, if used, would be minimalistic, line-based, and monochromatic, primarily using 'primaryForeground' white or 'secondary' orange for emphasis. They align with the monospaced, technical aesthetic.
graphicElements.stickers: No stickers or badges are used, maintaining a clean and professional look.
graphicElements.illustrations: No illustrations are present; the design relies on geometric shapes and gradients for visual interest.

brandBook.designSummary: This brand design features a modern, minimalistic aesthetic with a strong emphasis on grid-based structure and high contrast. The primary colors are black and white, providing a clean and professional backdrop, while vibrant orange and soft lavender gradients serve as accent colors to highlight key interactive elements and create visual interest. Typography is monospaced and typewriter-inspired, reinforcing a technical and coding-related theme. The layout is modular and asymmetrical, using clear columns and rows with visible grid lines to evoke a sense of precision and order. UI components such as buttons are sharp-edged and functional, primarily using the 'secondary' orange color for calls to action. The overall visual personality is futuristic, energetic, and tech-savvy, suitable for technology conferences or digital product showcases.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' black color predominantly for backgrounds and large text blocks to create strong contrast with the 'primaryForeground' white text. The 'secondary' orange color is reserved for call-to-action buttons, highlights, and interactive elements, paired with 'secondaryForeground' black text for readability. The 'lavenderGradientStart' and 'lavenderGradientEnd' colors form a smooth gradient used in large background blocks and overlays to add a modern, digital feel without overwhelming the design. The 'gridLine' color is used subtly for background grid lines to reinforce the structured, technical aesthetic. These colors should be combined thoughtfully to maintain accessibility and visual hierarchy, ensuring that text and interactive elements stand out clearly against their backgrounds.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primaryForeground' white text on 'primary' black background meets WCAG AAA contrast standards for all text sizes. The 'secondaryForeground' black text on 'secondary' orange background meets WCAG AA standards for normal text and AAA for large text. The lavender gradient colors provide sufficient contrast when used with black text for headings and body copy. The 'gridLine' color is light and used only for non-interactive background elements, ensuring no accessibility issues.

initialPrompt: Build a modern, dynamic, and responsive company website for Mastersolis Infotech using AI-assisted tools. The site should include: 1) Home page with hero banner, tagline, dynamic AI-generated content, testimonials, and service highlights. 2) About page with mission, vision, values, AI-generated team intros, and company milestones. 3) Services page with AI-generated service descriptions and optional AI chatbot. 4) Projects page with portfolio, tag-based search, and filtering. 5) Contact page with form storing submissions in database and automatic AI-generated email responses. 6) Admin dashboard for content management and analytics with AI-based summaries. Additional features: Career page with dynamic job listings, application form, AI-generated acknowledgment emails, and resume filtering tool that extracts candidate info, formats resumes, provides job-fit analysis, and ATS-friendly formatting. Blog/News page for admin to add posts, AI-generated summaries/SEO, and AI-summarize button for visitors. Testimonials & Case Studies section with AI-generated/rephrased testimonials and AI-assisted case study summaries. All features must be functional and integrated for a seamless user and admin experience.
